content.prompt: In the interest of reviving classical Greco-Roman style, Renaissance architect Filippo Brunelleschiâ€™s plan for the Pazzi Chapel notably drew on features from other existing buildings, such as the

choices.label: symmetrical plan, horizontal entablatures, and loggia of the Palazzo Rucellai
open-air plan, elliptical shape, and arcades of the Colosseum (Flavian Amphitheater)
central plan, large dome, and oculus of the Pantheon
rectilinear plan, longitudinal nave, and clerestory of Santa Sabina

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.2: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain why a specific work of art (or group of related works of art) demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
